intro: Heleniastrum, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Heleniastrum has narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
